intro: Cyrtandra imparis, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Cyrtandra imparis plays an important role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii's native flora.
